text:
June 3, 1959
Dr, Marshall McLuhan, Chairman
Culture and Communications Seminar
29 Wells Hill Avenue
Toronto 10, Ontario, Canada
Dear MarshallÂ»
The pressure of the last week or so has been pretty great. Spent
M.dayf Saturday, Sunday pouring concrete and otherwise fixing
wreckage at home, You should see my blisters I
We've sent through your travel voucher. It appears that you listed
nothing for food, taxis, etc., so we added reasonable amounts to
cover, and raised the amount of train fare to the actual sum. If
you don't receive your check in a week or so from NAEB Treasurer
Bob Coleman, let me know. Attached Is copy of voucher as sent thru'.
The USOE blanks sent you are for your file. As procedures become
clearer, even for first steps, let me have than for Walter.
I think we'll hold announcement of grant until revised grant-
contract form is for sure approved chez Walter. I'll be in touch
with him. Hope to check signals when I'm in Washington to testify
before FCC June 17.
I know, with all of us so fatigued, that the day or so here were
trying ones. And I felt a good deal of personal regret about this.
I am confident, have unlimited faith in, and respect and affection
for, you. We'll make this one go.
Glad to hear of McMillan interest in the Gutenberg Era. It will be
basic. - -
Upward and onward! And I hope we both survive the next few months
so we're ready to go September 1.
Our very best,
HJS/dp
Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director
